msItem.title: Ordo ad benedicendum cimiterium
msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo ad benedicendum sive consecrandum cimiterium
msItem.incipit: Aufer a nobis domine iniquitates nostras ut ad sancta sanctorum puris mereamur mentibus introire
msItem.explicit: Qui vivis et regnis cum Deo Patre in unitate Spiritus sancti Deus per omnia secula seculpru. Amen.

msItem.title: Ordo qualiter dedicacio ecclesie et altaris fieri debeat
msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo qualiter dedicacio ecclesie et altaris fieri debeat
msItem.explicit: ut hic et sacramentorum virtus et votorum obtineatur effectus. Per Dominum.

msItem.title: Ordo pro consecracione altaris
msItem.explicit: ut hic et sacramentorum virtus et votorum obtineatur effectus. Per Dominum nostrum Ihesum Christum et cetera.

msItem.title: Ordo pro consecracione altaris portatilis
msItem.rubric: Sequitur consecracio altaris portatilis sive tabule itinerarie
msItem.explicit: et nostram benedictionem, in nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus sancti. Amen. Pax tecum. Et cum spiritu tuo.

msItem.title: Reconciliacio violate ecclesie
msItem.explicit: atque fidelium tuorum tibi pie offerencium vota in illa sanctifica. Qui cum Deo Patre et cetera

msItem.title: Ordo qualiter cimiterium violatum reconciliari debet
msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo qualiter cimiterium violatum reconciliari debet
msItem.incipit: Aufer a nobis Domine inquietates nostras

msItem.title: Ordo qualiter sacri ordines fieri debeant
msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo qualiter sacri ordines fieri debeant mensis primi
msItem.incipit: Nos N Dei gracia episcopus N districtius sub excommunicacionis
msItem.explicit: Corpus Domini nostri Ihesu Christi prosit tibi sumenti in vitam eternam

msItem.title: Ordo pro indumentis sacerdotalibus fuerint consecranda
msItem.rubric: Pro indumentis sacerdotalibus cum plura simul fuerint consecranda
msItem.explicit: et tibi in eis devote et amicabiliter servientes gratos efficere dignare. Per Christum.

msItem.title: Ordo ad consignandum pueros
msItem.incipit: Ordo ad consignandum pueros sive infantes. Infantes in brachijs dextris
msItem.explicit: Benedicat te omnipotens Deus Pater et Filius et Spiritus sanctus. Amen.

msItem.title: Feria Quinta maioris ebdomade
msItem.rubric: Feria Quinta maioris ebdomade sedente domino pontifice pro foribus ecclesie
msItem.explicit: redeamus accessum per tuorum custodiam mandatorum. Per Dominum.

msItem.title: Ordo ad vocandum episcopum
msItem.rubric: Incipit ordo ad vocandum et examinandum seu consecrandum electum episcopum
msItem.explicit: Qui vivit et regnat et cetera. Pax tibi.
msItem.rubric: Et det ei osculum et ceteri episcopi.

msItem.title: Ordo ad intronisandum novum episcopum
msItem.incipit: Sta et retine locum a deo tibi delegatum
msItem.explicit: Ego N illius ecclesie episcopus esse

msItem.title: Missa
msItem.rubric: Missa propria episcopi in die consecracionis sue

msItem.title: Consecracio sacrarum virginum
msItem.rubric: Consecracio sacrarum virginum que in epiphania vel in 2a feria pasche aut in nataliciis apostolorum aut dominicis diebus celebratur
msItem.explicit: stipate me malis quia amore langueo euouae
msItem.rubric: qui est in thalamo in ineffabili gloria te coronabit in eternum. Amen.

watermarks.p: According to Strömberg (see bibliography) who saw the manuscript sometime before 1955, before it was rebound, there are two different watermarks, now barely visible: 1) the palm of a hand surmounted by a flower, similar to Briquet 11417, dated to 1477-1480 and to Briquet 11430, dated to 1547; and 2) a gothic P, similar to Briquet 8534, dated to 1502 and to Briquet 8535, dated to 1507.

collation.p: The original collation is disturbed by restoration and rebinding sometimes after 1955 when Strömberg saw it and described it. According to his quire analysis there were 11 quires, all senions except the first and the last quire that both had 13 leaves and the seventh quire (with script in a differnt hand) that had 10 leaves.

layout.p: Ff. 2-72 and 84-131 are ruled in ink where there is musical notation; ff. 75-83 are ruled in ink also for the text; 16 written lines; written space: 130 x 80 mm.; ff. 72v-74v; 83v; 119r-v; 132r-v are blank.

handDesc.p: Two hands: Cursiva currens in ff. 2-72 and 84-131; Textualis Formata in ff. 75-83. The instructions to the priest are rubricated.

binding.p: Ochre coloured silk binding with preserved 17th century satinwoven silk covering. Sweden 20th century. Size: 208 x 150 x 38 mm.

Ochre coloured silk binding over millboards. Satinwoven silk covering from former binding preserved on the new covering. The silk covering have holes likely from ties. Tight back with three double raised bands. Library code tooled in black at the tail of the back. Former edge trimming preserved. Two plain flyleaves and pastedowns of paper. All along sewing on three raised double cords. Textblock restored.

foliation.p: The manuscript is foliated in pencil in the upper right corner of recto side of the leaf, probably in connection with the rebinding. NB that the current foliation is not in agreement with the one given by Strömberg in his critical edition.

additions.p: There is a note on f. 1v in the hand of Gustaf Magnus Sommelius, professor of Eastern languages and Greek and librarian in 1767-1799, saying: Ritus pontificiorum circa consecrationem Coemiteriorum, altarum etc.

origin.p: Roskilde (cfr. f. 122v: Ego soror N promitto stabilitatem meam et conversionem morum meorum et obedienciam secundum regulam sancti Benedicti coram Deo et beatis martiribus quorum reliqie hic habentur et omnibus sanctis in hoc loco qui vocatur Roskildis constructo in honore beatissime virginis Marie in presencia domini N episcopi N priorisse., first third of the 16th century.

acquisition.p: By the end of the 17th century the book was owned by E. J. Meck (1644-1702), cfr. former callnumber on f. 1v. In 1704 the manuscript arrived in the University Library as part of a donation of 25 manuscripts out of which 7 Medieval (see Gerle E. Lunds universitetsbiblioteks historia fram till år 1968, Lund 1984, pp. 47-48 and LUBA. A IV b 10).

recordHist.source: Catalogued October of 2005 by Eva Nilsson Nylander.

bibl.title: Den pontifikala liturgin i Lund och Roskilde under Medeltiden. En liturgihistorisk studie jämte edition av pontificale lundense enligt handskriften C 441 i Uppsala universitetsbibliotek och pontificale roscildense enligt medeltidshandskrift nr. 43 i Lunds universitetsbibliotek.
Studia theologica Lundensia
